pullRequest.body:
`Polynomial.coeffList` is the list of coefficients, in descending order from leading term to constant term. (The zero polynomial has coeffList of `[]`). The PR defines coeffList and proves some basic facts, notably relating `P.coeffList` to `P.eraseLead.coeffList`.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

- [x] depends on: #9082 
- [x] depends on: #9083

Part of #9052.

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).

Thanks! A first batch of comments below - please don't take them as discouraging.
Thanks! A first batch of comments below - please don't take them as discouraging.

```suggestion
  relation is the (classical) logical negation of a transitive relation. In other words,
```
This does not appear to be used in this PR; I suggest you split it out if you need it elsewhere.
Oops, yes. I was using it an earlier draft, but (since get! is now not used the same way in Mathlib) in my cleanup I no longer needed it.
Please revert
These should be bundled into an iff as well
Why Î· as variable name?

```suggestion
    âˆƒ ls : List Î±, P.coeffList = P.leadingCoeff :: ls := by
```
Let's add a variant with `List.head` too
... plus one

I think
```suggestion
    P.coeffList.length = if P = 0 then 0 else P.natDegree + 1 := by
```

Probably
```suggestion
  constructor <;>
  Â· intros
    exact (Polynomial.eraseLead_coeff_of_ne _ (by linarith)).symm
```
or
```suggestion
  constructor <;> intros <;>
    exact (Polynomial.eraseLead_coeff_of_ne _ (by linarith)).symm
```
Swap the sides so you can use \le
You're not using `get!`
I'm not convinced we want to use `getElem!` in mathlib either

```suggestion
    rw [List.getElem?_cons_succ, List.getElem?_reverse (by simpa [hd] using hnp),
```
This proof is quite long and hard to follow. Is there anything you could split out?
Shadowing variables isn't great. I suggest putting `{Î± : Type*}` at the type and adding `Semiring` and `Ring` sections

```suggestion
  Â· simp only [hp, mul_zero, natDegree_zero]
  Â· rw [â† zero_add p.natDegree, â† natDegree_C a]
```

```suggestion
    simp [ha, hp]
```
or
```suggestion
    simp only [leadingCoeff_C, ne_eq, mul_eq_zero, ha, leadingCoeff_eq_zero, hp, or_self,
      not_false_eq_true]
```
if you prefer

Stylistically:
```suggestion
  set c := f.support.card with hc
  cases hâ‚ : c
  case zero => by_contra; exact h (card_support_eq_zero.mp hâ‚)
  case succ => exact Nat.succ_inj'.mpr (card_support_eraseLead' (hc â–¸ hâ‚))
```
but simpler as:
```suggestion
  have hâ‚ : f.support.card â‰  0 := by simpa
  obtain âŸ¨c, hcâŸ© := Nat.exists_eq_add_one_of_ne_zero hâ‚
  rw [hc, card_support_eraseLead' hc]
```
This is already `Polynomial.two_le_natDegree_of_nextCoeff_eraseLead`

```suggestion
  mt nextCoeff_eq_zero_of_eraseLead_eq_zero h
```

```suggestion
theorem eraseLead_ne_zero_of_nextCoeff_ne_zero (h : f.nextCoeff â‰  0) : f.eraseLead â‰  0 :=
```
Are the changes in this file necessary? If not, please split out
le

pullRequest.title: feat: `Polynomial.coeffList`

source.title: Lemmas for Descartes' Rule of Signs. Notably `coeffList` and `IsCoequiv` as new defs.
